description:
I am using a KVM system c46058.rch.kstart.ibm.com on RHEL6.3 and every few seconds I see these errors in compute.log:

nstance-0000003e: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000003e/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.422 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000003: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000003/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.440 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000002: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000002/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.507 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000a: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000a/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.632 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000b: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000b/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.699 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000074: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000074/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.823 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000c: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000c/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.832 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000003d: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000003d/disk'

I have 2 servers - 1 on KVM and 1 on HyperV
The instances in the log above are not listed on either of those.  They are also not listed when issuing 'nova list'

I tried to clean up the db with the following commands:
openstack-db --drop --service nova
openstack-db --init --service nova

Even after issuing those commands I still receive these ERRORS repeatedly in compute.log

I see that this issue is similar to other bugs that have been opened in community:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1123274
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/984996

The nova level I am using is:
Source commit:  e07173818ce3a81d3fa35ffeb9479a39d8cefeab
title: nova.virt.libvirt.driver [Errno 2] No such file or directory - repeating error in compute.log

comments.content:
I am using a KVM system c46058.rch.kstart.ibm.com on RHEL6.3 and every few seconds I see these errors in compute.log:

nstance-0000003e: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000003e/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.422 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000003: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000003/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.440 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000002: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000002/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.507 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000a: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000a/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.632 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000b: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000b/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.699 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-00000074: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-00000074/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.823 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000000c: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000000c/disk'
2013-05-09 10:57:46.832 23716 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000003d: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/instance-0000003d/disk'

I have 2 servers - 1 on KVM and 1 on HyperV
The instances in the log above are not listed on either of those.  They are also not listed when issuing 'nova list'

I tried to clean up the db with the following commands:
openstack-db --drop --service nova
openstack-db --init --service nova

Even after issuing those commands I still receive these ERRORS repeatedly in compute.log

I see that this issue is similar to other bugs that have been opened in community:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1123274
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/984996

The nova level I am using is:
Source commit:  e07173818ce3a81d3fa35ffeb9479a39d8cefeab
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jbelden

comments.content: Additional info, this is essentially code running at 2013.1 tag for Grizzly GA and libvirt_nonblocking is set to True in nova.conf.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
the function that logs this (nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.get_disk_over_committed_size_total()) is generating a list of domains to check by querying libvirt on the system.

I suspect you have instances already defined or orphaned instances in libvirt.

What does 'virsh list' show on the KVM box? Are all the VMs listed there under nova management?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cfb-n

comments.content:
I have 2 servers, one is KVM and one is hyperv.  Virsh is empty, and hyperv does not contain the instances that are found in error state on compute.log:

[root@c46058 ~]# virsh
Welcome to virsh, the virtualization interactive terminal.

Type:  'help' for help with commands
       'quit' to quit

virsh # list
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jbelden

comments.content: Deleting the instance recode from db can reproduce this bug. That is because the instance-xxx.xml are not actually deleted from libvirt. instance-xxx.xml is still existed in /etc/libvirt/qemu/.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~yugsuo

comments.content: I removed the instance-xxx.xml from /etc/libvirt.qemu/ and still am seeing the error messages in my compute.log file.  I have updated systems, restarted services, and drop/init the db, but still see the errors.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jbelden

comments.content:
I had same errors on my Ubuntu 12.04 with Grizzly.  Try to delete instance-xxx.monitor files from /var/lib/libvirt/qemu.

On my Ubuntu test setup I use these commands to completely clean up system without reinstall:

apt-get -y autoremove --purge mysql-* nova-* keystone quantum-* openvswitch-* rabbitmq-server cinder-* glance-* apache2-* openstack-* django-* python-keystoneclient libvirt0 libvirt-bin ceilometer-*
rm -rf /var/lib/nova /var/lib/keystone /var/lib/cinder /var/lib/glance /var/lib/ceilometer /var/lib/mysql /var/lib/libvirt
rm -rf /var/log/apache2/* /var/log/mysql/* /var/log/nova/* /var/log/cinder/* /var/log/glance/* /var/log/quantum/* /var/log/ceilometer
rm -rf /etc/mysql /etc/libvirt
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~nab

comments.content:
i met the similar problem. i think this will be useful 
https://answers.launchpad.net/nova/+question/229581
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~huangxufu

comments.content: Try to use virsh list --all to show all domains which include the defined ones.  If someones is just defined but not running, you should undefine these.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bowei-fan

comments.content:
Here is my condition:
OpenStack Version: Havana on ubuntu 12.04
There is such ERROR log in nova-compute.log every minute: "2014-08-25 02:16:14.615 38853 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] Getting disk size of instance-0000001d: [Errno 2] No such file        or directory: '/var/lib/nova/instances/4792d8fd-e169-470b-bbc8-82b363aaf192/disk'"

When I see the nova db, the status of instance 4792d8fd-e169-470b-bbc8-82b363aaf192 is already deleted.

According to Bowei Fan, I check it in virsh command:
root@compute:/etc/libvirt/qemu# virsh list --all
Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 12    instance-0000001f              running
 17    instance-00000028              running
 19    instance-00000025              running
 22    instance-00000023              running
 23    instance-00000024              running
 -     instance-0000001d              shut off
 -     instance-00000027              shut off

It shows that the status of  instance-0000001d is shut off. So I just undefine it : virsh undefine instance-0000001d
root@compute:/etc/libvirt/qemu# virsh list --all
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------
 12    instance-0000001f              running
 17    instance-00000028              running
 19    instance-00000025              running
 22    instance-00000023              running
 23    instance-00000024              running
 -     instance-00000027              shut off

After that, the ERROR log I mentioned aboved doesn't appear any more.
But I have a question, is this a nova bug or something else?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~iamzyz

comments.content:
I have also met with this issue several times. 
My setup uses Ubuntu 12.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.2.0-58-generic x86_64).
Any update on this issue?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wzhengxian

comments.content: Additional , in HAVANA version with 2 compute nodes , 1 network node and 1 controller node
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wzhengxian
